    Developing for saturnR

    developing_for_saturnR.Rmd

    If you want to develop for this package there are a few things to take into consideration.

    Documentation

    The documentation page is generated with roxygen and then pkgdown to generate the page. We are using github pages to host it. However because the code is hosted on GOGS we have a separated repo for the documentation. Currently the _pkgdown.yml has:

    destination: ../saturnRpage/docs

    Which means that the html documents generated by pkgdowns::build_site() are going to be located in that folder. The yml file can be modified to change this.

    The ../saturnpage/ folder is tracked individually in git and hosted in github using github pages. This has to be set up.

    Tests

    This package has tests for the functions related with reading ufs files and writing/reading ufm files. Most of the tests are done using Epsom SATURN data. Please make sure you write and execute the tests before updating the repository. The tests should not produce any warning.

    testthat::test() #or Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + T

    Any helper files to be used in tests are in ./inst/extdata/ to access them for tests/vignettes or other purposes we use saturnR_example() function.

    Data Requirements

    The package loads an external data set to get the p1x codes necessary to read the ufs data. The original file is located in the ./data-raw/ folder with an R script to convert from the csv to an internal data object (using usethis::use_data()). Any other necessary dataset should be included in the same way with a tracked script.

    News

    Any changes and new versions should be reflected in the NEWS.md file to keep the Changelog up to date

    Releases

    Some versions have been saved as releases using the tag system

    git tag v1.1
git push --tags

    That way the user can use the following code to install a specific version for better reproducibility.

    devtools::install_github("http://uksta1ap007/arwa.sayegh/saturnR.git", ref = "v1.1")

    Once created the releases should appear on the release page.
